The next Biennial should take place at the Saint-Germain Museum in Paris, in the spring of 2021. The event will be hosted by Jean-Pierre Blondel and will feature the work of more than 150 contemporary artists from seventy countries. The biennial will be preceded by a special exhibition of work by the artists of the USA and Canada. The original lineup of artists included Piet Mondrian, Rezaul, Koons, Blum, Boak, Kudacki, Witwicky, and Beasley. The total operating budget for the biennial is estimated at $160,000. The plan to hold the biennial in the French capital has been in the works for some time. Earlier this year, the institution commissioned works by the artists of Russia, Belarus, and Ukraine, among other countries, and is considering organizing a version in Moscow. The exhibition, titled The Architectural Phenomenon, [2019], was organized in collaboration with the local branch of the Visual Arts University, and was organized as a public art project with the support of the local museum.
